etymologies: 1960s; earliest use found in Jewish Heritage. From Yiddish farbrengen social gathering, use as noun of farbrengen to spend (time) from German verbringen, in the same sense from ver- + bringen

definitions: A Hasidic gathering, usually with eating, drinking, singing, and discussion of Hasidic teachings, held especially on the Sabbath and other festivals or significant days.

notes.text: The term is used by Chabad-Lubavitch Hasidim: other Hasidim refer to such a gathering as a bote or tish.
